instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: 2015 Macbook Pro Display Issues- <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: We have a water damaged 2015 Macbook Pro that originally came to us from another shop having display issues.  Sometimes backlight works sometimes it does not.  We have replaced the display and the entire logic board and the display issue continues??  Has anyone seen anything like this?

threads.title: 2015 Macbook Pro Display Issues- <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Do not understand.....

[QUOTE="Puevig reven, post: 6283"] We have replaced the display and the entire logic board and the display issue continues[/QUOTE]

It means have you tried other display in the original logic board and the original display in other logic board and the problem is still there in both cases?????

Please explain....

threads.title: 2015 Macbook Pro Display Issues- <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
2015 Macbook Pro Display Issues- <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Thank you Duke-I will check it first thing tomorrow morning!!

threads.title: 2015 Macbook Pro Display Issues- <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
We have tried new logic board in damaged laptop- issue still occurs.
Then we tried another display with the new logic board on the damaged laptop- issue still occurs;(
